website_summaries.verdict: It's versatile and convenient to store, but it has some issues.
pros: Boasts a sleek, stainless steel design that easily fits most sink tops and kitchen decor
cons: The silverware holder is in on the small side, but this isn't a major concern considering the price

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw prevents large dishes from standing upright
customer_reviews.text: Although this dish rack is attractive and sized large enough to hold a lot of dinnerware, it has one HUGE DESIGN FLAW - the raised wires where you would put dishes are so low that dishes cannot stand upright! I don't know how the dishes in the picture are standing upright. I tried several styles and sizes of dishes, and all but the smallest dishes simply fall to the side. The manufacturer should surely take steps to correct this. I have not had it long enough to be able to comment on whether it rusts quickly or not.
customer_reviews.author: portcitygal

customer_reviews.title: "Stainless steel" rusting in less than 1 year
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a very poor quality "stainless steel" as this wire dish rack is shows signs of rust and it's not even one year old. While I expect rusting on lesser quality plated dish racks, I am quite disappointed to see rust this dish rack.
customer_reviews.author: Harry56

customer_reviews.title: Great stainless steel dish rack, so so base....
customer_reviews.text: I checked out many dish drainer designs and settled on this one. On the plus side the stainless steel wire rack itself is very nicely made and will last a very long time. On the negative side the plastic base was a bit warped when it arrived. I fixed that with some carefully applied hot water and some gentle persuasion. I also added tapered side rails to support the edge of the base so that water will drain properly off the base. Without that detail the water will just lay flat in the base pain. So with some modification this thing works very well.... just beware of those details if you decide to order one.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Unique and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely easy on the eyes. I've been looking everywhere for a dish drainer with a stainless steel rack and a hard plastic base in a modern design, and here it is. The rack is built to hold small glassware without the possibility of falling through the rungs, which was a problem with my last dish rack; and it's compact shape doesn't take up a lot of counter space. The only little glitch is the silverware holder; small things tend to fall over and lay on the bottom, but this is minor. Overall, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Nice Dish Rack, but It Rusts
customer_reviews.text: It's a dish rack -- not much to say about features. it works well as a dish rack. But I don't believe it really is stainless steel. Mine rusts! Not all over, but at the wire-to-wire welds, and on the bottom of the wires where the water drops hang. Also, the feet, which sit in water, have rusted. My guess is the metal is "sorta stainless" but not as high-quality as stainless used to be before it all came from China. I have an older dish rack, with US stainless, that hasn't a spot of rust in 20 years. It's an OK dish rack, but if you expect it to be rust-free, you'll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: From the Beach

customer_reviews.title: I love it except for the fact the plastic tray on ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and now that it has arrived, I love it except for the fact the plastic tray on the bottom is cracked. It appears the leg of the drainer itself was forced through it perhaps during shipping.. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Karen Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it (a solid 4 out of 5)
customer_reviews.text: We've had this dish rack for a few months and no signs of rust or any problems with it. The design is pleasing to the eye and doesn't look bad sitting out on your counter. The plastic drainage board that sits underneath doesn't necessarily drain on its own so sometimes it has to be manually tilted to drain out, but that's not a huge deal. The one thing I'd change is that I wish it were designed so that cups/glasses could be hooked onto the perimeter of the rack (like with most dish racks). There is not a great way to secure glasses. Overall though, I'm happy with this dish rack.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: I really like the smallness of it cause I do not like ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the smallness of it cause I do not like clutter. I really like the drain board because the drain spout is not opened completely. The price was perfect and received it very fast!! Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adelina M. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Nothing stands up like it should. Not enough room. Stopped using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works !!!
customer_reviews.text: 2nd strainer I bought and the first one was awful. This is sturdy, does what it is supposed to do and looks nice. Sort of disappears into the counter top. Not too large and not too small (I never write reviews but had to on this one.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this rack for over two years now, and use it for multiple loads of dishes daily. It hasn't once rusted, and the plastic utensil holder has lasted just as long under heavy loads as well. It can be a bit tedious to wash down should the need arise, and I also ended up tossing the plastic bottom, opting to use a microfiber drying mat underneath instead, but overall I'm very satisfied with this drying rack.
customer_reviews.author: Alistair

customer_reviews.title: OVER-PRICED FOR INFERIOR QUALITY...My 30 year old dish drainer is better than this!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This dish drainer is very poorly made. First of all it is not level... it wobbles back and forth. Second of all, the separate container for the silverware does not sit properly on the chrome bars because one side of the drainer is slightly higher than the other. Therefore, the plastic doesn’t lay flat on the chrome and it too wobbles. Also parts of the the chrome are very sharp and someone could get cut. This product is definitely over priced, $30 for the inferior quality is absurd. I am giving it one star based solely on it’s attractive appearance from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: Maria K.

customer_reviews.title: It neatly fits underneath our cabinets and is able to hold a good assortment of dishes/cups
customer_reviews.text: Moved in with the husband so we needed all new everything. Saw other products with similar color scheme and styling but I ultimately decided on this on. It neatly fits underneath our cabinets and is able to hold a good assortment of dishes/cups. There is nothing hotter then when your husband does the dishes. Now he doesn't do them often but when he does oh boy does it get steamy in the kitchen and I'm not talking about the hot water if you know what I mean...I give it a 90% due to the price which is a bit high.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Kim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fo my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This was better than expected. It is easy to keep clean and looks sleek and stylish beside my sink. I use it every day. My only suggestion would be to make the dividers in the flatware container attachment a little taller to keep the items from falling over. Taller dividers will keep items like spoons standing up to drain. Otherwise I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: CAG

customer_reviews.title: Rack: Great. Drain board: Bad.
customer_reviews.text: The rack itself is great! But I'm really sad about the drainboard. I don't think it's poorly designed, but I do think it's either a poor choice of material, or poorly manufactured. Essentially it's warped in a way that doesn't allow water to drain out the spout. It ends up pooling to the sides where the rack feet are. I'm afraid this may lead to rust in the future, but maybe it won't. Either way, it leads to standing water on the drain board itself. The picture shows an upward curve, which makes water flow to the side instead of out of the drain board. Video shows how warped it is. Unfortunate, because I like the rack itself.
customer_reviews.author: nfinite

customer_reviews.title: Worth it --
customer_reviews.text: This dish drainer was exactly what we were looking for. No, there aren't any cup/glass hooks on it, but we use our dishwasher for those. The high sides make it easy to stack pots, pans and items that do not fit in the dishwasher. It is sleek looking, and the silverware drainer easily fits inside or outside of the rack. The only complaint I have is that the included plastic under tray drainer arrived broken and unusable. The seller said they were not able to replace it and that I should contact Amazon and return it. To me, that is an excessive waste of money -- We will keep it and deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I will be very satisfied with it
customer_reviews.text: Assuming this stainless steel caddy proves to be very rust resistant, I will be very satisfied with it. The dish caddy is a nice design and works well for the relatively small number of items we use it for. The silverware caddy is almost worthless since it doesn't have well designed partitions. It's really unbelievable that a company would design a nice stainless steel caddy like this and then put such a ridiculous silverware caddy with it. If it had a decent silverware caddy, I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Dish Rack
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! Perfect size for limited counter space, single meals. I don''t use a lot of dishes so it is just the right size for me, Stainless steel makes it practically invisible but when you do look at it, it is very attractive.
customer_reviews.author: shelley

customer_reviews.title: Missing piece
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Opened this and didn’t see the extra piece that’s for placing your utensils to dry.. nothing . The box says it includes it but there is nothing else in the box . Might be returning . It does look nice , just missing that piece I need
customer_reviews.author: Katie Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Accommodating Stylish and Practical Dishdrain
customer_reviews.text: Generally speaking, really nice dish drain. It’s a good size and holds a lot of dishes, breadboards, silverware, pots, pans,etc.. Seems very sturdy and looks good. (To be honest, who really likes the look of a dish drain? BUT, you need them, short, sweet and simple!). Do like (alot) silverware holder which is partitioned well to hold up utensils. It also can be moved in or out of drain. Drainboard is ok, I prefer a mat. So far, happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Gail E. Marder

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and color does not fade
customer_reviews.text: This is modernized, stylish and clean look. Perfect size and easy to maintain. It looks good on my modern style kitchen. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Sung

customer_reviews.title: This is such a pretty and spacious drying rack
customer_reviews.text: This is such a pretty and spacious drying rack. Even though it's white, it doesn't seem to have stained after a year of daily heavy use (I bought this for my mom, who does not use her dishwasher). The stainless steel has not spotted or rusted either. I even like this rack better than the $80 Simple Human rack I have in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: SI801

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: I received the drying rack two days ago. I like it a lot. It looks nice and has plenty of room for dishes and other items. Love the stainless steel. I will probably look for a stainless steel container for cutlery. I am using a mason jar at the moment. This is probably because I prefer stainless or glass to plastic. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: cuppa*tea

customer_reviews.title: looks nice, okay quality
customer_reviews.text: This produce looks quite nice, but the metal is very thing and seems flimsy. The elevated bar to hold plates in place is very low, so large plates don't stand upright very well. Also, because of the orientation of the plate holders I can't fit as many plates as I could with my old dish drainer. But so far it's working okay. I did not use the silverware older at all since the dividers in it were totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: continental congress

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. I use my dish drainer mostly for pots and pans and items that cannot go into the dishwasher. This dish drainer is roomy enough for my dinner pots and knives, yet small enough to fit on the counter where I have space. I feel I do have to either slant it more or just empty it myself to get the water to drain into the sink, but at least it isn't all over the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Sargent Mama

customer_reviews.title: IT's PERECT
customer_reviews.text: If you have a 60/40 sink, this is the dish drainer for you! It fits inside the 40 side perfectly. It also comes with a draining mat that is very snug, but it's not necessary to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cramer

customer_reviews.title: The Utensil holder DOES have dividers......
customer_reviews.text: I read a review that the utensil holder didn't have dividers and it showed a picture of forks and spoons laying flat at the bottom. That's not true. The utensil holder DOES have dividers but they are short which I think is a plus. That way I can get down in there and clean it which was an issue with the ones that have full length dividers. If you don't want your spoons an forks to fall over just lean them to one side or the other. Who ever wrote that review can't be too bright.
customer_reviews.author: New E-reader

customer_reviews.title: It's fine, but it came broken
customer_reviews.text: It's fine, but it came broken! The drain pad has a big hole, big hole!!! in it where the rack end meets, and the other side of the mat is cracked ..... Not happy about that at All ....... But I'm keeping to replace our current rack, I can buy another mat locally to replace, not worth trying to send back!! .... But not acceptable. I think one of the reviews said the same thing. So did I get their return? I don't know!! Not really that happy.
customer_reviews.author: shepherdmom

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to put in my sink because it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put in my sink because it is larger than the others and stainless steel. Just right for my uses. The utensil holder could use a divider. It doesn't have padded feet as it is meant to go on its drain board. I'll have to come up with a solution for that :)
customer_reviews.author: Babs Odell

customer_reviews.title: Tray is not sturdy. Will not allow water to drain.
customer_reviews.text: The actual rack is fine so far. However the tray or "base" flexes way too much therefore does not allow water to drain. Water puddles in the four corners and right at the "spout" of tray. Poor design!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, nice design
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, great design, hope it lasts--too soon to say, all the other metal ones I've owned rusted eventually, but now, it's really nice. Only thing is that the silverware cup was a bit too big for just me and my wife, so fortunately we still had the old rack and its silverware cup which was smaller, so we use that one to save space.
customer_reviews.author: DougH

customer_reviews.title: Flat on bottom (doesn't drain well) and no cup or water bottle holders.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be sturdy enough. My issues with this: No cup/bottle holders so that cups/bottles dry properly Mat underneath is just a mat. It doesn't tilt to one side so the water that collects below doesn't drain. Rack itself is also flat (not tilted).
customer_reviews.author: minibus

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT!!! Fits my deep and wide stainless steel Elkay sink perfectly. Sits inside about 3" so water drains into sink yet leaves 8" below the basket. No counter space lost. Love it! Threw out the plastic utensil holder and bought the Neat-O stainless steel utensil holder. Manufacturer should make that substitution as well.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Dish Drainer and Rack
customer_reviews.text: For a few months we shopped many stores in person and on line and read LOTS of reviews. W finally settled on these items and could not be happier. Although the size is not smaller than what we had, the design makes it appear smaller and looks much neater on our countertop. We are very happy with the straight up sides design and the ease of cleaning it. We will not go back to the plastic/rubber type we have had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Even though I've not heard of this brand, it was a great buy. The product is as described, appears to be of decent quality, functional, and worth the asking price ($29.99). Usually, I buy the Simple Human products, but they tend to be pricier and the design is not as sleek/modern as I'd like them to be. My last dish rack was Simple Human brand and it was very difficult to keep clean as its dripping tray had too many ridges, nooks and crannies, which were difficult to reach and clean out.
customer_reviews.author: Anon Y

customer_reviews.title: Good looking rack but not the tray...
customer_reviews.text: The rack is fantastic... I am a big fan. The drip tray doesn't work one bit as the water collects in the corners and does drain to sink... even if I prop it up on one end. Lucky for me it fits near perfect in my sink so it stays.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Attractive item reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I received product in a reasonable time. Everything is stainless steel In my kitchen, appliances, so it matched. It is easy to clean.It was a little light. Attractive design. Overall a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hauptfleisch

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, nice design, less very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Siamese if you please...

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this dish rack very much. The material is very good and strong. It can hold quite many dishes/bowls as it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Wattakorn

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The dish drainer itself is really perfect -- looks sleek and doesn't discolor. Looks very shiny and elegant. I gave it 4 stars because the silverware holder is plastic. If it had been stainless steel as well, the whole thing would have looked more expensive. Plastic just cheapens the look a bit. I still think it's the best dish drainer for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Guy

customer_reviews.title: Small, but usable
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than the last dishwasher rack I owned (from Costco), but it fit easier on my counter top. I don't like how the utensil tray sits on inside of apparatus because it takes away space for dishes. The catch try doesn't drain unless propped up at an angle. Otherwise it's functional.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M.

customer_reviews.title: A stylish dish drainer!
customer_reviews.text: This wire dish drainer is small so it doesn't take up your entire counter. The plastic drain tray underneath is sturdy and won't become misshapen. It was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Winning Dish Drainer!!!
customer_reviews.text: Since my ‘chrome’ basket has rusted, I spent lots of time poring over reviews & looking for a new basket. Ordered one & had to return it, poorly made & a piece broke off. I’ve only had a few days but very happy with the stainless steel dish basket & drainer. It’s made very well, sturdy & holds a lot of items that don’t go in my dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Groom

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and modern looking
customer_reviews.text: Love it, stylish, modern, hope it doesn’t rust like others
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Classic and perfunctory
customer_reviews.text: My husband thought it didn't feel sturdy enough, after a month of use, he's changed his mind. This looks clean and classy and there is a lot of space for utensils. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Attractive
customer_reviews.text: The rack and drain board are exactly as shown and are exactly the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasting and practical solution
customer_reviews.text: Sufficient size for a family of four cooks. Will fit multiple cutting boards, large plates and a pot or two at the same time. Fits into the stated dimensions, benefits from placement next to the wall. Stays clean and rust free even after 6 months of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Folger

customer_reviews.title: Clean and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a product that would not rust and still look stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita G. Hedges

customer_reviews.title: Stainless In Kitches All The Rage
customer_reviews.text: I try to buy American. It is made in China. However, it is sleek, modern, and just the right fit. Both my spouse and I like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Bj

customer_reviews.title: Rusts at all seams
customer_reviews.text: Rusts at all seams within a year or so. The metal has not rusted, but the solder is rusted. Looks great otherwise, but not worth it if it's gonna rust. I use with a towel rather than plastic drain tray. Just bought another brand to try because of rust issue.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Little

customer_reviews.title: It looks really nice, but after just two weeks using it
customer_reviews.text: It looks really nice, but after just two weeks using it, it started to have small rust spots: it's not stainless!!! It's a pity because it's very practical.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Perez Balverdi

customer_reviews.title: Two years later still looks like new
customer_reviews.text: I love this drainer. It is classy and holds a lot without being too big. Two years later and it has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Key West Sun

customer_reviews.title: ... bit more height to the back so water drains better.
customer_reviews.text: The only things I'd change would be making the dividers in the cutlery dish higher but that's not that big a deal and it helps hide the blade of large knives and adding a bit more height to the back so water drains better.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: I do't think I could do better.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. I do not have a dishwasher and my old chrome drawner was rusting. I do't think I could do better.
customer_reviews.author: George Ritchey

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for about 2 months now, so still kinda early to tell durability, but it looks good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Neen

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Got this today and it is bigger than I thought, which is great for all the things I handwash. Seems durable and sturdy. Also, previous reviews stated some people could not get utensils to stand upright because the caddy had no dividers. Mine had 3 dividers so I had slots to put utensils without them falling in. Love it so far and will update this review if it does not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with product design
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with product design. It has good weight, dimensions and layout. Only time will tell as far as rust. Other racks reviewed on Amazon have had issues with rust. Also, good price.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L. Szekely

customer_reviews.title: This dish drainer is very nice looking stainless steel and clear plastic
customer_reviews.text: This dish drainer is very nice looking stainless steel and clear plastic .....not the conventional style but sleek and nice. We have a dishwasher so this is for those items that I wish to hand wash like larger kitchen tools and plastics. Works great! I definitely would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Garyt

customer_reviews.title: It is a very nice, ( Stainless Steel ) dish drying rack
customer_reviews.text: It is a very nice , ( Stainless Steel ) dish drying rack. I would tell any body this is a good drain rack, it very good quality. I would buy another one I if needed to. The size of it is outside of it, 12" x 16"1/2,i really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry J.

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel dish drainer
customer_reviews.text: Very nice dish drainer. I like the stainless steel that matches my kitchen appliances. Nice size.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie West

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: we've only been using this for a couple days but like it a lot. easy to clean, seems to hold more than it appears it would given the size. Hoping it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: judy beardslee

customer_reviews.title: That the product was as the seller advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack. Fits sink perfect, easy to clean and organize dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn O'Keefe

customer_reviews.title: Does not rust!
customer_reviews.text: Like this very much - of value and a solid product. Wash every now and then. No down side. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: b-va

customer_reviews.title: This looks great and I've had no issue with the utensil holder ...
customer_reviews.text: This looks great and I've had no issue with the utensil holder like some others (based on their reviews) However, I wish it was a bit larger - for a compact kitchen - this is ideal. We will be keeping it though because it looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Puja Katari

customer_reviews.title: Most dish racks have a black drain tray which shows the white film and looks really bad. This one is one of only 2 that ...
customer_reviews.text: My home gets very hard water which leaves a white film on everything it touches. Most dish racks have a black drain tray which shows the white film and looks really bad. This one is one of only 2 that I saw on amazon which has a white drain tray and that's why I bought it. It looks good and I really like it. My reason for only 4 stars is that it doesn't drain. I hope I am not looking at rust down the line; it's not great to have to turn it upside down to drain the tray and wash away the yuck in the corners.
customer_reviews.author: daughterless mother

customer_reviews.title: Good rack
customer_reviews.text: We finally moved up from plastic. This rack does everything expected from a rack.
customer_reviews.author: DTM

customer_reviews.title: Sleek dish drainer
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that wouldn't rust. This is very nice and sleek looking. I thought it was small enough to fit into my sink to spare counter space, but it doesn't. Nevertheless, I am happy with it. I hang the utensil caddy on the outside to allow more space for dishes. The separations in the caddy should be higher so utensils don't fall down.
customer_reviews.author: devy1525

customer_reviews.title: Nice modern drying rack in your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful stainless steel drying dish rack that actually improves the look of the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Saines

customer_reviews.title: I’ve sleek style
customer_reviews.text: Love the modern style.. looks great in my stainless sink!
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: NICE, NICE, NICE
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and discarded so many dish racks from wires to plastics. This by far is the best looking of all. Black ones tend to get indelible water stains maybe white will be better. If you were looking for an alternative to black, this is it. The color is almost transparent white it will blend with any color in your kitchen. Minimalistic in design and yet functional.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and Handy
customer_reviews.text: For a home with a dishwasher available, this is the perfect choice -- compact and well designed. We love the clean lines and the great utility of this product.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Terry

customer_reviews.title: Nice unobtrusive dish drainer with clean lines
customer_reviews.text: Nice unobtrusive dish drainer with clean lines. After looking at (and in one case even buying) a few different models that turned out to be too bulky or lacking in practical space, this was the perfect solution for our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Z.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for our sink
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for our sink. We don't need or use the plastic tray since it just sits inside the sink.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a dish drainer for awhile. Hard to find. Finally found this one and I love it. Easy to clean and does what it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey at over 30.00 but great design and materials.
customer_reviews.author: vito mannina

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with my stylish dish rack
customer_reviews.text: One of my smartest purchases for my kitchen. Not only is it optically very pleasing, but my dishes dry faster. It probably has to do with the venting. Compared to the standard plastic dish rack, this one helps to transport the water faster into the tray. The air can circulate much easier through the dishes. I'm very happy with my stylish dish rack!
customer_reviews.author: Gaby C.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack looks beautiful on my counter top. It looks exactly like the picture. I appreciate the allotted space for utensils. It’s just right for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi.C

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This dish drainer fits perfectly next to the sink in our shared, work-place kitchen. It is stylish, functional, and well-priced. I can't ask for much more!
customer_reviews.author: CandJJB

customer_reviews.title: This Doesn't Rust!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this next to my sink for over a year now. It gets wet every day, and so far, has not rusted one bit! Very pleased at its performance and appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Malcham

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is just exactly what I have been looking for. Easy to keep clean. Drain tray is removable, which is a must for cleaning. My only suggestion to make this even better is to make a larger one to accommodate glasses and cookware. However, I may be the only person in the USA that does not have an automatic dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Anita R. Shimp

customer_reviews.title: It has nice simple clean lines that I wanted for my new modern kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, just the right size. I can stash it away in my sink cabinet when I don't want it on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: laurie

customer_reviews.title: Spacious
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint with this dish rack is I wish the one side was angled up a little higher so water drained on it's own rather than me having to lift it up and dump it once i'm done. Otherwise this is perfect. Easy to clean and big enough to hold dishes from breakfast and lunch.
customer_reviews.author: AngelRose

customer_reviews.title: Does its job while looking good. But doesn't tilt.
customer_reviews.text: It looks good, have plenty of space but it doesn't tilt. The water pools at the bottom and requires me to lift it every once in a while to get the water out. Having a tilted base would make this a perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: Sincerely Noob

customer_reviews.title: Good Dish Rack
customer_reviews.text: The dish rack looks nice and is well made. It is as expected. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Snead

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned they would quickly look rusty, but they look great.
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: First one damaged so getting a replacement.But I like it !!
customer_reviews.text: I like it but had to get an extra silverware basket - the round chrome one looks nice. I am returning the first one I received as the plastic tray had a puncture in it where one of the feet goes. Hope this second one is without issue.
customer_reviews.author: veebu

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty and isn’t rusting
customer_reviews.text: Using this for about a month and no rust anywhere. It’s compact and very pretty.
customer_reviews.author: alsatian5

customer_reviews.title: I like it’s clean look
customer_reviews.text: I like it’s clean look, and the size is perfect for my counter. It hold a a days worth of dishes and the drain pad keeps my counter dry. All my dishes can air try in this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Whorton

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit in a standard stainless steel sink
customer_reviews.text: The rack has been doing very well for it's purpose. I have had no problems with it other than not looking for the dimension of the thing when I bought it. My bad. The rack works well on the counter and still looks beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but too small and not functional
customer_reviews.text: It’s smaller than I expected, and the plates don’t stand up- all dishes become a pile in the basket. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: learning a new way to "rack" dishes is the hard ...
customer_reviews.text: learning a new way to "rack" dishes is the hard part. Product well packed, delivered on time, fits our tiny counter well and seems to be the right solution.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen O'Mara

customer_reviews.title: But I don't like the way most look
customer_reviews.text: It's a dish drainer, so I wan't expecting much. But I don't like the way most look, so when I saw this I had high hopes. And they were me! A very stream lined, stylish piece. Might not be as big as others, but it's perfect for me and for hand washing my vintage glasses. And it looks so pretty sitting on my counter. :)
customer_reviews.author: Messina

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price..
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dish rack. Very sturdy, looks great and most of all, glasses do not drop out.
customer_reviews.author: Rina

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! Met my best expectation ;). Attractive, sturdy, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: A.E.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Nice, strong drainer. Not flimsy. Mat is not tilted so you need to physically dump it but that's not a big deal to me. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: drobvit

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: i have used this tray only for 3 months and rust is showing on top and more on bottom side. I do not recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Azra

customer_reviews.title: Almos pefrect, bot not.
customer_reviews.text: It looks great. However, the tray is made flat and not with an incline which makes it hard for the water to make it to the spout and out of the tray. Also, the basket itself is not very deep.
customer_reviews.author: Maritsa MW

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact look
customer_reviews.text: This sounds silly, even for me, but I love this dish drainer, it's a little different looking for someone who has always had the name brand and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mame

customer_reviews.title: Large and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Really like this dishwasher rack. It's large, sturdy, fits my small kitchen well but still large enough to hold many dishes and silverware.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't like the configuration of the dividers.
customer_reviews.text: This outfit looks nice, but I would have preferred having the plates turned the other way. I have not had it long enough to know about the rust question.
customer_reviews.author: Carole

product_meta.title: Stylish Sturdy Stainless Steel Metal Wire Medium Dish Drainer Drying Rack (Stainless Steel, Chrome)
product_meta.description: A stylish modern streamline design dish drainer adds contemporary feeling to your kitchen. Sturdy stainless steel construction can hold stoneware and heavier dishes. Matching color silverware cup and drainboard are included. Functional medium size with measurement 16.5"(L) x 12"(W) x 5.5"(H) approximately.
feature_bullets: Durable build to last stainless steel constructon
Medium-sized drainer with slots to hold up more than 8 dishes
Matching color silverware cup and drainboard are included
Dishrack measures 16.5"(L) x 12"(W) x 5.5"(H); drainboard measures 17.125"(L) x 12.375"(W) x 1"(H) approximately

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars874 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
